byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from San Bernardino, Salman Masood from Multan, Pakistan, and Michael S. Schmidt from Washington. Reporting was contributed by Declan Walsh from Cairo, Waqar Gillani from Multan, and Ian Lovett and Rick Rojas from San Bernardino.
byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, SALMAN MASOOD and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation says Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik, couple who killed 14 people in San Bernardino, Calif, had been radicalized for long time; investigation so far reveals they had been practicing at target range days before their murderous attack.
lead_paragraph: The husband and wife had been practicing their aim at a target range in the Los Angeles area days before the massacre in California last week.

headline.main: Killers Were Long Radicalized, F.B.I. Investigators Say
headline.print_headline: 2 Killers Were Radicals a Long Time, F.B.I. Says

snippet: The husband and wife had been practicing their aim at a target range in the Los Angeles area days before the massacre in California last week.
